name: Kepler-243
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-243 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-243 is a star with 0.7350000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.84 times its radius. It is located 2308.99 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-243 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-243 b

Kepler-243 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-243.

The mass of Kepler-243 b is 8.30 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-243 b is 2.45 that of Earth. At 8.30 Earth masses, Kepler-243 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-243 c

Kepler-243 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.03 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-243.

The mass of Kepler-243 c is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-243 c is 1.99 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, Kepler-243 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-243, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
